availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Ballard (Madison County resident and Union soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Tebercus B. Ballard and Miranda Ballard. Stepson of Lee Ann Walker Ballard. Resident of Madison County in 1850. Resident of Madison County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from October 18, 1861 to December 31, 1864. Served in the Madison County Militia (Kentucky National Legion) as a captain in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 230B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 273.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County,Richmond, p. 237A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0001.
KYR-0001-008-0002.
